    • Method Detail

      • addWallet

        public SirqulResponse addWallet(Long accountId,
                       Long offerId,
                       Long offerLocationId,
                       Boolean usePoints)
                         throws SirqulException
        Adds an offer to the wallet. If type VOUCHER then attempts to purchase, otherwise it is just added to the wallet directly.

        Target API Endpoint: /wallet/create
        Parameters:
        accountId - the account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required)
        offerId - The id of the offer being added (offerId or offeLocationId required)
        offerLocationId - the offer location id to add
        usePoints - if a voucher and set to true then use points, otherwise use credit card on file
        Returns:
        a SirqulResponse with a message of success or fail
        Throws:
        SirqulException - the SirqulException. A custom exception type specifically thrown by this Sirqul SDK.

      • buyWallet

        @Deprecated
public SirqulResponse buyWallet(Long accountId,
                                  Boolean usePoints,
                                  Long offerId)
                         throws SirqulException
        Deprecated. use addWallet

        Adds an offer to the wallet by going through a purchasing process. The account must have previously set up a payment type that has been validated or they must be using credits previously purchased. The purchase will make a request to the credit card billing system and report the result.

        Buy wallet.

        Target API Endpoint: /consumer/wallet/buy
        Parameters:
        accountId - the account id
        usePoints - the use points
        offerId - the offer id
        Returns:
        SirqulResponse
        Throws:
        SirqulException - the SirqulException. A custom exception type specifically thrown by this Sirqul SDK.

      • getOfferTransaction

        public OfferTransactionResponse getOfferTransaction(Long accountId,
                                           Long transactionId,
                                           Boolean includeMission,
                                           Location location,
                                           Boolean returnFullResponse)
                                             throws SirqulException
        Gets the offer transaction.

        Target API Endpoint: /wallet/get
        Parameters:
        accountId - the account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required, deviceId sent automatically)
        transactionId - the offer transaction id to get details of
        includeMission - if true then include mission data, false to not include
        location - the location of the user
        returnFullResponse - indicator to return the full response
        Returns:
        OfferTransactionResponse on successful response, SirqulResponse on error.
        Throws:
        SirqulException - the SirqulException. A custom exception type specifically thrown by this Sirqul SDK.

      • removeWallet

        public SirqulResponse removeWallet(Long accountId,
                          Long transactionId)
                            throws SirqulException
        Removes the transaction from the wallet by setting the deleted date to the current date/time. Requires a valid account and transactionId.

        Target API Endpoint: /wallet/delete
        Parameters:
        accountId - the account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required)
        transactionId - the offer transaction id to remove
        Returns:
        a SirqulResponse with a message of success or fail
        Throws:
        SirqulException - the SirqulException. A custom exception type specifically thrown by this Sirqul SDK.

      • searchWalletOffers

        public SearchResponse<OfferTransactionResponse> searchWalletOffers(Long accountId,
                                                          String keyword,
                                                          Long retailerId,
                                                          Long retailerLocationId,
                                                          Long offerId,
                                                          Long offerLocationId,
                                                          Enums.CouponType offerType,
                                                          Enums.OfferTransactionApiMap sortField,
                                                          Boolean descending,
                                                          Integer start,
                                                          Integer limit,
                                                          Location location,
                                                          Boolean redeemed)
                                                            throws SirqulException
        Gets all of the active offers currently in the wallet. This will not return already redeemed offers.

        Target API Endpoint: /wallet/search
        Parameters:
        accountId - the account id
        keyword - The keyword to search for
        retailerId - Filter results for this retailer
        retailerLocationId - Filter results for this retailer location
        offerId - Filter results for this offer
        offerLocationId - Filter results for this offer location
        offerType - Filter results to only return COUPON or VOUCHER offers
        sortField - Determines what to sort the results by {CREATED, UPDATED, SEARCH_TAGS, ACTIVE, ACTIVATED, EXPIRES, TITLE, SUBTITLE, OFFER_TYPE, SPECIAL_OFFER_TYPE, OFFER_VISIBILITY, CUSTOMER_ID, CUSTOMER_DISPLAY, RETAILER_ID, RETAILER_NAME, RETAILER_LOCATION_ID, RETAILER_LOCATION_NAME, BILLABLE_ENTITY_ID, BILLABLE_ENTITY_NAME, RESPONSIBLE_DISPLAY}
        descending - Determines whether the results are in descending order
        start - The start index for pagination
        limit - The limit for pagination
        location - the location of the user
        redeemed - if true return redeemed transactions (status 2), otherwise return active transactions (status 0 or 1)
        Returns:
        SearchResponse<OfferTransactionResponse> on valid response, or SirqulResponse with error message
        Throws:
        SirqulException - the SirqulException. A custom exception type specifically thrown by this Sirqul SDK.

      • updateWalletOfferStatus

        public OfferResponse updateWalletOfferStatus(Long accountId,
                                    Long transactionId,
                                    Long offerLocationId,
                                    Boolean usePoints,
                                    Integer status,
                                    Location location,
                                    Boolean returnFullResponse)
                                      throws SirqulException
        Update wallet offer status. The status values are: 0 - not redeemable, 1 - redeemable, 2- redeemed. Not redeemable means the customer has received the offer but has not decided to use (or print) it yet. Until they choose to do this the merchant cannot redeem the offer (has not been given permission yet). Redeemable means the customer has chosen to use the offer and wishes to redeem it. Redeemed means the merchant has accepted the offer and the given the customer its value, then marked it a used in the system.

        Target API Endpoint: /wallet/update
        Parameters:
        accountId - the account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required)
        transactionId - the offer transaction id to remove
        offerLocationId - the offer location id
        usePoints - the use points
        status - the status value to change to (0 or 1)
        location - the location of the current user
        returnFullResponse - Indicates to return full response
        Returns:
        a OfferResponse or SirqulResponse with a message of fail
        Throws:
        SirqulException - the SirqulException. A custom exception type specifically thrown by this Sirqul SDK.
